headline: Grover, Meet Basma and Jad
abstract: What happens when the people who invented educational television try to reinvent humanitarian aid?
lead_paragraph: In its 50 years on television, “Sesame Street” has presented an expansive idea of the challenges of childhood, offering lessons on divorce, racism, grieving and autism — as well as help with the alphabet and accepting friends who are a bit taller and more birdlike.
